item.title: Escape From Duckov: How to Reach the Warehouse Area
item.description:
There are several explorable maps in Escape From Duckov , and once you've had your fill of Ground Zero, the Warehouse area is going to be your next crucial step forward. This region is a lot denser and more populated than Ground Zero, but it also has more loot for you to take home after a successful raid.

Getting to the Warehouse area in Escape From Duckov is quite simple, albeit easy to overlook. In this guide, we'll be showing you where you need to go and what you need to bring in order to reach this new area.

How to Get to the Warehouses in Escape From Duckov

You can find the path to the Warehouse region by following the forest trail north of the bunker's main entrance in Ground Zero . From the crossroad near the bunker, go to the left, then just keep heading north past the trees and hostile ducks. You'll eventually reach a camp next to a pond, and just a little bit up north from there is a big, cracked wall . The path to the Warehouse area lies just beyond that.

The quickest way to get to the location mentioned above is to take the wormhole just north of the hideout entrance . You'll need a grenade to break the wall there.

How to Destroy Walls in Escape From Duckov

Cracked walls can be destroyed with explosives , like hand grenades and dynamite. Equip your chosen explosive in one of your quick access slots, then hold your Fire button to line up your throw. Release the button to chuck the explosive, but mind their damage radius. Stand too close, and you'll get turned into dinner.

You should be able to buy a grenade from the Vending Machine back at base. They're fairly cheap, and if there aren't any available, look for sticks of Dynamite instead. Otherwise, look around Ground Zero for explosives — Tactical, Weapon, and Ammo Boxes have a small chance to contain explosives. The route we used for making quick cash in Escape From Duckov includes two good spots where you can potentially find explosives as well as bigger guns and gear.

Xavier, the Weapons NPC, sells grenades for 600 Currency.

Escape From Duckov: Warehouse Beacon Location

Players can teleport to other regions in Escape From Duckov by building a Teleporter in the hideout , but before the Teleporter can function, you'll first need to activate a beacon somewhere in the world.

In the case of the Warehouse area, the beacon here is found near the Gas Station, one of the points of interest on the east side of the map. The beacon is also right next to an extraction point. You may not be able to teleport back to base using beacons, but at least you'll be able to use the extraction point here to get back home safely with your hard-earned loot, assuming the extraction point is active in the first place.

Escape from Duckov

item.title: Escape from Duckov: How to Expand Storage
item.description:
Running out of space is one of the most common problems players face in Escape From Duckov . Like any good extraction game, your success relies on what you can bring back to your base. Between collecting weapons, materials, and random loot from every mission, your storage fills up faster than you expect. Without enough space, you’ll constantly be forced to throw away items you might need later. Interestingly, there are multiple ways to expand both your warehouse and backpack storage in Escape from Duckov .

How to Expand Warehouse Storage in Escape from Duckov

Firstly, you can upgrade your base warehouse by adding different Storage Expansions to permanently increase your total capacity. This way, you can store more weapons, items, and crafting materials.

To apply an expansion, go to your main storage container and scroll your mouse wheel to switch through menu modes. Select the Storage Expansion tab , then use the Expansion Upgrade. At Storage Expansion Lv.1 , you’ll get +35 Storage capacity . The more you upgrade your warehouse, the more storage tabs and organization features you’ll unlock.

Warehouse upgrades also require in-game currency, which you can earn by selling items at vending machines.

Where To Find Storage Expansion Boxes

You can also expand your storage using Storage Expansion Boxes. These are quite rare and you’ll have to make significant progress to find them. You’ll usually come across them while exploring the world, searching lockers, toolboxes and enemy camps, or opening loot crates during missions. These items appear as Expansion Boxes and come in different sizes. The larger the box, the more space it will add once you use it.

Since this method is heavily dependent on RNG, it's quite unreliable, so don't rely on it fully. While some players have reported finding these boxes, we haven’t encountered one in our playtime yet. We’ll update this guide once we do.

​How to Increase Backpack Capacity in Escape from Duckov

Your backpack storage determines how much you can carry during missions. To upgrade it, head to the Skill Enhancement Machine at your base once you’ve unlocked it. Select the Backpack Expert skill to improve your carrying capacity. All enhancements here cost money and specific materials.

You can also find backpacks while exploring and looting in the wild. When found, these items are consumed to permanently add extra slots to your existing bag. Equipping body armor can also increase your carrying capacity . Both backpacks and armor can often be obtained by defeating enemies.

Escape from Duckov

item.title: All Black Scales & Phantasmal Herbs in Ninja Gaiden 4
item.description:
In Ninja Gaiden 4, increasing your max health will be one of the best ways to ensure you can endure through the ever-increasing challenges the game presents. To increase your maximum health in NG4 , you'll need to collect two specific items: the Black Scale and Phantasmal Herb. These items are found throughout the game, and are acquired through a variety of methods. In this guide, we'll show you where to find all Black Scales and Phantasmal Herbs in Ninja Gaiden 4 .

How to Increase Yakumo's Max Health in Ninja Gaiden 4

Black Scales and Phantasmal Herbs:

The process for increasing the size of the health bar in NG4 is simple. First, you need to collect one unit of two specific items. The first item is a Black Scale, and the second item is a Phantasmal Herb. Once you collect one of each item, NG4 will automatically combine them into a new upgrade item called the Dragon Lord's Grace.

When a Dragon Lord's Grace is successfully created, Yakumo will automatically consume the item, increasing the size of his health bar by a small amount. Judging by information provided in the game, it appears that you can increase Yakumo's max health ten times, which means there should be ten Black Scales, and ten Phantasmal Herbs.

Many of the Black Scales and Phantasmal Herbs are acquired through side-missions. You must make sure to accept the side-missions at the start of each chapter. Check the first DarkNest Terminal, and then each subsequent terminal, for new missions. Also, remember to turn in your missions to any DarkNest Terminal once they are complete. You must do this to receive the reward.

Where to Find All Black Scales in Ninja Gaiden 4

All Black Scale Locations:

Scale #

Location/Chapter

Image

Black Scale 1

Chapter 2 : After making your way up the rooftop steps with floating drones, you'll face an elite enemy before jumping on a yellow rail. The first Black Scale is in a chest at the end of the short alley to the left if you are facing the elite enemy head-on.

Black Scale 2

Chapter 3 : Locate the ' Rotting Charm' for the associated side-mission. You'll find the charm later in the chapter, once you've entered the shrine. As you make your way through, you'll encounter an area after locating the Food Thief that looks more like the outside, with a large blue cargo container. The charm is in a chest behind the container.

Black Scale 3

Chapter 4 : While fighting through the chapter, you'll find a chest at the top of a set of stairs, guarded by two spear-wielding enemies. The scale is in the chest. The area appears to be a shrine or memorial of some kind, and as such it's hard to miss.

Black Scale 4

Chapter 4 : Complete the 'Secret Supplies' mission. You can find the supplies in a special high-tech chest that has a unique glow. It is found in a large clearing where the wreckage of a high-tech flying machine is encountered. There are several chests in the area, but the secret supplies stand out.

Black Scale 5

Chapter 8: Complete the ' Antiquated Currency' mission. After collecting the Pond Strider, you'll make your way through an obstacle course. Near the end, you'll encounter two of the large fish fiends with portals in their mouths. Look for a large 'keep out' sign painted on a wall behind one of the fish. After defeating that fish, there will be a chest directly behind it that contains the currency. Note: If you don't go back to a terminal to turn this in before leaving, it will be a bit before you can do it in Chapter 9. You'll find Black Scale 6 before finding the next terminal.

Black Scale 6

Chapter 9 : In this chapter, you'll encounter open areas that you can navigate with the Pond Strider. After clearing the first open area, slide under the gate into the second open area. In the second area, you'll find a water channel that leads you back to an area similar to the Purgatory location in the first open area. There are several tough enemies here, and the Black Scale can be found in a chest in the middle of the land mass.

Black Scale 7

Chapter 12: After the first combat encounter in Chapter 12, you'll head up a set of stairs and see the next door you must pass through. Just before reaching the second set of stairs that lead to the door, turn right, and you'll see a chest against a fence and near a stack of pallets. This chest contains Black Scale 7.

Black Scale 8

Chapter 12 : Complete the " Classified Documents " mission — Near the end of the chapter, you'll reach an area where the lights suddenly turn red. This will occur just before the entrance to a long series of corridors that lead to the elevator ride that takes you to the end of the chapter. Just before the door, turn right, and you'll find a chest along the wall that contains the documents. Turn them in at the final DarkNest Terminal to receive the Black Scale.

Where to Find All Phantasmal Herbs in Ninja Gaiden 4

All Phantasmal Herb Locations:

Herb #

Location & Chapter

Image

Phantasmal Herb 1

Chapter 1 : Collect the Data Chip near the three chests later in one of the outdoor combat arenas. There are three chests in a row that are very hard to miss if you look. You'll receive the first Phantasmal Herb when you turn in the mission at a DarkNest Terminal.

Phantasmal Herb 2

Chapter 3 . While in a circular chamber in the shrine, you'll see a very slender alcove with a chest at the top of a set of stairs. The herb is found within the chest.

Phantasmal Herb 3

Chapter 5 : Locate and turn in the ' Heirloom Knife' for the associated mission. You'll find the knife behind one of the large enemies that spits fireballs as you are gliding up the mountain. It will be near the end of the climb, but this is easy to miss, so make sure you take them all out and check behind them. It appears as a small pillar of light from a distance.

Phantasmal Herb 4

Chapter 5: Locate and turn in the 'Tengu Offering' for the associated mission. You'll sign up for this mission earlier, but it is completed in Chapter 5. After defeating the statue boss, which looks like the statues you've been destroying up to this point, you'll want to look left as soon as you exit the building. The Tengu Offering will be on the ground. It's very dark as you exit, so look for the small pillar of light.

Phantasmal Herb 5

Chapter 6: At the start of the level, after landing on the bridge, head in the direction of the DarkNest Terminal and Tyran's Raven. To the left of the terminal, you'll see two chests near the broken remains of an old suspension bridge. The chest on the edge of the cliff contains

Phantasmal Herb 5.

Phantasmal Herb 6

Chapter 9: Find all 3 'Beautiful Minerals'—these are items spread throughout Chapter 9. All of them are found in chapter nine, so make sure to thoroughly explore each area. They are always out in the open, marked by pillars of light like non-chest mission items.

Phantasmal Herb 7

Chapter 11: As you make your way through the first stage of the Dragon's Maw, you'll find yourself riding on rails. This herb is found in a chest on a platform off to the left of a rail. Just before you jump on the correct rail, you'll climb a large wall with E-4 printed on it. The rail has a blue speed-boost ring as soon as you jump on it. After jumping on the rail, you'll have to jump over several obstacle rings, then slide under one of the gates. Immediately after sliding under the gate, you'll see the platform off to the left. Jump to it, defeat the enemies, then open all chests.

Phantasmal Herb 8

Coming Soon

Coming Soon

Phantasmal Herb 9

Coming Soon

Coming Soon

Phantasmal Herb 10

Coming Soon

Coming Soon

Ninja Gaiden 4
9 /10
Released
October 21, 2025

item.title: Escape From Duckov: Where to Find The Bronze Pocket Watch
item.description:
Completing quests in Escape From Duckov is important. Not only do they guide players on how the game's foundations work, but they also give bucket-loads of XP and money for your troubles. However, quests aren't always simple, and most of the time, players will really need to pay attention to what quest givers say about the stuff they want done.

Much like the survival-extraction games that Escape From Duckov takes inspiration from, many of its quests have vague objectives. The Bronze Pocket Watch quest, for example, will have players looking for a tank truck somewhere east of Ground Zero. If you're wondering where to find the watch for the Weapons NPC, then here's a quick guide showing you what you need to do.

Escape From Duckov: Bronze Pocket Watch Location

Like the quest description says, the Bronze Pocket Watch is in a tank truck at the far east side of Ground Zero . To get there, you'll first need to get 2 Wood . You can usually find some in the tool boxes around the vicinity of the bunker entrance, but if you're not having any luck, you can always try checking the vending machine back at base.

Now that you have your two planks of wood, head to the east side of the map from the bunker entrance . From the crossroad, go to your right, and keep following the path until you find a broken bridge . Repair that bridge using the planks in your inventory, then cross it to reach a road full of abandoned vehicles. Follow that road south , and at the very end, you'll find truck with a tank on its back. Interact with the driver seat door of that truck, and you'll find the Bronze Pocket Watch.

The great thing about this quest is that it ends right next to a shortcut leading back to the bunker's cellar . To the left of the quest truck are a few boxes, and one of them is blocking a manhole cover. Interact with that box to remove it, and you'll unlock the shortcut back to base. You can use this shortcut at any time, and it's especially good if you want to fight the mercenary ducks further up the road to farm for cash and guns.

Return to Xavier, the Weapon NPC at your base, and give him the Bronze Pocket Watch. He'll give you 1000 EXP and 1000 Currency for your trouble. More importantly, you'll soon be able to take more quests from Xavier, and if you complete those, you'll unlock more of his inventory.

Escape from Duckov
